results.title: Live sheep export to Iran
results.brief_description:
Shows sheep being wormed, branded and fed on a farm before focusing on the modified oil tankers that eventually take them to Iran.

Music throughout is an up-beat synthesised piece with a middle eastern bent.

results.title: Off the rails: memorabilia of the Great Western Railway
results.creator_credit: David G. Rose, Mike Slee, Kathy Rose, Philip Goodhand-Tait and Span Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Story of steam”.
The history of a nation’s progress is the history of her sons’ achievements, their hopes and disappointments, their failures and successes. English history during the past one hundred years provides no finer example of this than the story of that great railway which linked London with the West Country. This documentary traces the history of the Great Western Railway (GWR) through archival footage and stills, and the Great Western Society which was set up around the early 60s by a group of schoolboys. Over the years the members of the Society have collected and restored all manner of memorabilia belonging to or used by the GWR to the point where eventually they established the Small Relics Museum at the Didcot Railway Centre in Oxfordshire. Many examples of these pieces are shown throughout the documentary along with a visit to one of the last GWR signal boxes still working. A must for all those lovers of railways and steam trains. Introduced and narrated by Mike Savage.
results.title_for_label: Off the rails: memorabilia of the Great Western Railway
results.creator_credit_for_label: David G. Rose, Mike Slee, Kathy Rose, Philip Goodhand-Tait and Span Pictures

results.title: Story of standards

results.title: Story of Peter and the Potter
results.creator_credit: Donald Peters and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When Peter accidentally breaks a glass bowl intended as a birthday gift for his mother, Mr. and Mrs. Deichmann and their daughter Anneke, all artisans in clay, come to the rescue and make him one of their designs while Peter watches. Every stage, from the first turn of the potter’s wheel to the final glazing and baking, is shown.

results.title: Storms (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This program teaches children about the basic forces of weather. Demonstrations using everyday objects to illustrate rising warm air, falling cool air and the water cycle. Original animation illustrates causes of lightning, thunder and tornadoes, while satellite views of hurricanes show their swirling winds.

results.title: Storm over Asia = Potomok Chingis-Khana
results.brief_description: Set during the British occupation of Mongolia in 1920, this is the half heroic, half ironic story of Bair, a young Mongolian hunter-turned-partisan who is captured. A document in his possession identifies him as a descendent of Genghis Khan. The interventionists decide to ‘resurrect’ him as a puppet king. However Bair escapes and leads the Mongolian army against the interventionists. The intensity of the drama, strong feeling for landscape and dramatic use of montage (four or five times the usual number of shots for a feature of this length) have been compared with the work of D.W. Griffith. In effect, the film is one long chase which takes on mythic proportions while the plot takes on metaphoric and lyrical dimensions (the British army is literally ‘blown away’). The emotional impact disguises the methodological rigour of Pudovkin’s construction. Also known as The Descendant of Genghis Khan. Cast includes Valeri Inkizhinov. This fully restored and digitally remastered version contains an original score by Timothy Brock performed by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Mantis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
Enter the world of the insects to study a curious form of predatory behaviour. Mantis is a short computer animation utilizing sophisticated 3D techniques to create an immersive entomological environment in which we follow the misadventure of a praying mantis. During the animation the roles of “predator” and “victim” are switched to demonstrate how some animals must kill for survival while humans can kill for blatantly inconsequential reasons. Glenn Tracy is a graduate of the Advanced Diploma of Arts in Electronic Design & Interactive Media, Creative Media Department RMIT, Melbourne, Australia.

results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Mark Buchwald, Vladlen Barbe, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Klassika Studio Moscow and Lightyear Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories to remember”.
Sigourney Weaver narrates Andersen’s moving story of a young girl’s quest for her young friend who has been captured by the beautiful but heartless Snow Queen and taken to her icy palace far from humankind. Along the way she makes new friends who help her in her search. Based on Susan Jeffers’ illustrations for the picture book adaptation by Amy Ehrlich.
